pr_title: EQL: Introduce list declaration for `:` operator

timeline.message:
EQL: Introduce list declaration for : operator

Add syntactic sugar for performing case-insensitive comparison,
including support for the wildcard pattern, against multiple values.

type where field : ("a", "b", "c*")

Fix #64388

timeline.bodyText:
thanks for the fast turnaround on this.
quick nit/question -- does SEQ still make sense as a token name? I think the : has evolved into something beyond insensitive string equality
timeline.author: rw-access
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -100,7 +100,8 @@ operatorExpression
 //   https://github.com/antlr/antlr4/issues/781
 predicate
     : NOT? kind=IN LP expression (COMMA expression)* RP
-    | seqPredicate
+    | kind=SEQ constant

replies.bodyText: Yes, it does; it's a pattern used for all strings/tokens including , above. We could declare it line but that doesn't offer any advantages quite the opposite, makes parsing trickier due to lack of constants.
